normalized_plaintext.description: the spaces and punctuation are removed from the English text and the message is downcased

plaintext_segments.description: The plaintext should be organized in to a rectangle.  The size of the rectangle (`r x c`) should be decided by the length of the message, such that `c >= r` and `c - r <= 1`, where `c` is the number of columns and `r` is the number of rows.

cases.description: empty plaintext results in an empty rectangle
4 character plaintext results in an 2x2 rectangle
9 character plaintext results in an 3x3 rectangle
54 character plaintext results in an 8x7 rectangle
cases.plaintext: If man was meant to stay on the ground, god would have given us roots.

encoded.description: The coded message is obtained by reading down the columns going left to right.

cases.description: empty plaintext results in an empty encode
Non-empty plaintext results in the combined plaintext segments
cases.plaintext: If man was meant to stay on the ground, god would have given us roots.

ciphertext.description: Output the encoded text in chunks.  Phrases that fill perfect squares `(r X r)` should be output in `r`-length chunks separated by spaces.  Imperfect squares will have `n` empty spaces.  Those spaces should be distributed evenly across the last `n` rows.

cases.description: empty plaintext results in an empty ciphertext
9 character plaintext results in 3 chunks of 3 characters
54 character plaintext results in 7 chunks, the last two padded with spaces
cases.plaintext: If man was meant to stay on the ground, god would have given us roots.
cases.expected: imtgdvs fearwer mayoogo anouuio ntnnlvt wttddes aohghn  sseoau
